author: R Sivaraman
text:
It will connect Kanyakumari and Chennai, says Pon Radhakrishnan

Union Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon Radhakrishnan said on Wednesday that Centre has proposed to lay a four-lane national highway on the east coast from Kanyakumari to Chennai.

Mr. Radhakrishnan, who was here to lay the foundation for construction of approaches to a road overbridge in Villianur and inaugurate a major bridge across Thirumalairajanar in Karaikal, said, “In order to improve better connectivity and infrastructure, the ministry has proposed to lay a four-lane highway converting the existing East Coast Road which is under purview of Tamil Nadu government. The Union Minister of Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Nitin Gadkari has proposed to spend Rs. 10,000 crore on this project.”
title: Four-lane highway on east coast
